Text.Value: Does my immortality vex you?
I expected better. I thought I made clear the terms of our arrangement.
I think not.
Thief. Vandal. Idiot. Destroying the jar means nothing so long as I am here to punish you for it.
His spirit screams within these walls now. I think it's time you joined him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused by the torment he's put Thrumbo through, then threatening - leading into combat

Text.Value: Flesh and blood bind me to this plane. I will return. I will always return.
So. Rather than doing as you were told, you engaged in an act of wanton vandalism.
You think my immortality so easily destroyed? What you have done can be undone, though you will not live to see it.
See, spirits, how my killer walks into this salon with such brazen indifference.
Thief. None steal from Mystic Carrion and live to take another breath.

EditorData.logicalname: ALREADY GAVE THE HEART AND NOW PLAYER HAS IT AGAIN

Text.Value: Still you do not see. You do not understand.
You are fortunate my death was only a temporary condition. Shall we see if the same goes for you?
I will purge you from this plane. And I promise - you will never reach the next.
I will erase your spirit from existence.
You destroyed something very precious of mine, and now you dare to seek an audience with me?
Did you think you could destroy my property without consequence?
Foolish creature. You thought killing me once would be enough?
Perhaps a few centuries of servitude will enlighten you to the benefits of honouring your agreements.
Death will not banish me from this plane. Neither will you.
So, you destroy my canopic jars, then dare to seek an audience with me?
You will be punished.
I confess, I am beginning to find you similarly tiresome.
It was enough to seal Thrumbo's fate. I destroyed him at dawn.

Synopsis: One liner for when Father Carrion before starting combat, with different nodes for stages in the quest of killing him (destroying jar, destroying heart, having Thrumbo killed) as well as reactivity for him dying several times. Carrion is always angry at the player and will always start combat after these lines. He sometimes toys with the player before turning on them
